newsitem.title: USA: Oneida to sell Camden Wire unit.
newsitem.headline: Oneida to sell Camden Wire unit.

text.p: Oneida Ltd said Tuesday it had agreed to sell the outstanding stock of its Camden Wire Co Inc subsidiary to Aarque Cos of Jamestown, N.Y., for $51 million in cash and debt assumption.
The transaction involves a cash payment of about $35.2 million and the assumption of Oneida's guarantee on $15.5 million in Camden Wire debt, Oneida said.
Aarque, a metal fabricating firm, was founded by R. Quintus Anderson, a director of Oneida, the company said.
Oneida said the selling price is subject to a post-closing adjustment to reflect changes, if any, in Camden Wire's book value.
Closing of the transaction is subject to certain conditions but is expected before Oneida's current fiscal year concludes on January 25, Oneida said.
In fiscal 1995 Camden accounted for about $149 million of Oneida's total sales of nearly $514 million.
